game.ai

Class Regular

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.ai.AI
      • game.ai.Regular

  • public final class Regular
extends AI
    The Regular AI, i.e., the "Medium" AI. Plays like an actual person.
    Author:
    blackk100

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int HIT
      Constant value of '2' indicating that the position has been shot at and was a hit.
      private int LIKELY
      Constant value of '3' indicating that the position may have a ship part.
      private int MISS
      Constant value of '1' indicating that the position has been shot at and was a miss, or doesn't have a ship part.
      private int NO_DATA
      Constant value of '0' indicating that there isn't any data on the given location.
      private int[][] probability
      A 2-Dimensional boolean array indicating the possible locations of the ship.

      • probability

        private int[][] probability
        A 2-Dimensional boolean array indicating the possible locations of the ship. Takes the values of this.NO_DATA, this.MISS, this.HIT and this.LIKELY.

    • Method Detail

      • fire

        public int[] fire()
        Function for the AI to fire at the player's ships. The coordinates are initially randomly generated until a hit occurs ('hunt' mode). Then the AI fires in the 4 adjacent positions (if available, ex.: at the corners and edges, only 2 and 3 directions are available respectively). In the previous step, if another hit occurs, the AI continues firing in that direction until no more hits occur. The process is then repeated.
        Overrides:
        fire in class AI
        Returns:
        an integer array. The 1st value is the X-Coordinate. The 2nd value is the Y-Coordinate.

      • updateGridOpp

        public void updateGridOpp(Location[][] gridOpp)
        A setter for gridOpp. Also updates this.probability.
        Overrides:
        updateGridOpp in class AI
        Parameters:
        gridOpp - Location Grid of the Player

      • randomFire

        private int[] randomFire()
        Support function 1 for the AI to fire at the player's ships. The coordinates are always (psuedo-)randomly generated. Is identical to Sandbox.fire()
        Returns:
        an integer array. The 1st value is the x-Coordinate, 2nd value is the Y-Coordinate.

      • setProbability

        private void setProbability()
        Sets the probability values.

      • checkAdjacentHit

        private int checkAdjacentHit(int x,
                             int y)
        Returns whether the given coordinate has 0, 1, or 2 adjacent positions with hits.
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate
        y - Y-Coordinate
        Returns:
        an integer. 0 - No adjacent hits; 1 - 1 adjacent hit; 2 - 2 adjacent hits horizontally; 3 - 2 adjacent hits vertically.

      • setAdjacentLikely

        private void setAdjacentLikely(int x,
                               int y)
        Sets adjacent locations to be this.LIKELY. Only to be used if there are no adjacent location having this.HIT.
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate
        y - Y-Coordinate

      • setAdjacentLikely

        private void setAdjacentLikely(int x,
                               int y,
                               boolean direction)
        Sets adjacent locations to be this.LIKELY. Only to be used if there is a single adjacent location having this.HIT.
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate
        y - Y-Coordinate
        direction - a boolean indicating whether the ship is placed vertically (true) or horizontally (false).

      • setAdjacentMiss

        private void setAdjacentMiss(int x,
                             int y,
                             boolean direction)
        Sets the adjacent locations to the given coordinates as MISS.
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate
        y - Y-Coordinate
        direction - a boolean indicating whether the ship is placed vertically (true) or horizontally (false).

      • checkHit

        private boolean checkHit(int x,
                         int y)
        Returns whether the given probability location equals this.HIT.
        Parameters:
        x - X-Coordinate
        y - Y-Coordinate
        Returns:
        true if hit. false if not hit.
